info.description: This is a swagger documentation for the Midaz Transaction API
info.title: Midaz Transaction API

get.description: Get all balances by account id
get.summary: Get all balances by account id

get.description: Get all Operations with the input ID
Get an Operation with the input ID

put.description: Create or Update an AssetRate with the input details

get.description: Get an AssetRate by the Asset Code with the input details
get.summary: Get an AssetRate by the Asset Code

get.description: Get an AssetRate by External ID with the input details
get.summary: Get an AssetRate by External ID

get.description: Get a Balance with the input ID

delete.description: Delete a Balance with the input ID

409.description: Conflict: Cannot delete balance with active operations

patch.description: Update a Balance with the input payload

get.description: Get all Transactions with the input metadata or without metadata

post.description: Create a Transaction with the input DSL file

400.description: Invalid DSL file format or validation errors

post.description: Create a Transaction with the input payload
post.summary: Create a Transaction without passing from source

post.description: Create a Transaction with the input payload
Create a Transaction with the input payload
post.summary: Create a Transaction without passing to distribution

get.description: Get a Transaction with the input ID

patch.description: Update a Transaction with the input payload

post.description: Cancel a previously created pre transaction

400.description: Invalid request or transaction cannot be reverted

409.description: Transaction already has a parent transaction

400.description: Invalid request or transaction cannot be reverted

409.description: Transaction already has a parent transaction

patch.description: Update an Operation with the input payload

post.description: Revert a Transaction with Transaction ID only

400.description: Invalid request or transaction cannot be reverted

409.description: Transaction already has a parent transaction

Amount.description: Amount is the struct designed to represent the amount of an operation. Contains the value and scale (decimal places) of an operation amount.

value.description:
The amount value in the smallest unit of the asset (e.g., cents)
example: 1500
minimum: 0

AssetRate.description: AssetRate is a struct designed to store asset rate data. Represents a complete asset rate entity containing conversion information between two assets, including all system-generated fields.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the asset rate was created
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

externalId.description:
External identifier for integration with third-party systems
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

from.description:
Source asset code
example: USD
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

id.description:
Unique identifier for the asset rate
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

ledgerId.description:
Ledger containing this asset rate
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes
example: {"provider": "Central Bank", "rateName": "Official Exchange Rate"}

organizationId.description:
Organization that owns this asset rate
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

scale.description:
Decimal places for the rate
example: 2
minimum: 0

source.description:
Source of rate information
example: External System
maxLength: 200

to.description:
Target asset code
example: BRL
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the asset rate was last updated
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

Balance.description: Balance is the struct designed to represent the account balance. Contains available and on-hold amounts along with the scale (decimal places).

available.description:
Amount available for transactions (in the smallest unit of asset)
example: 1500
minimum: 0

onHold.description:
Amount on hold and unavailable for transactions (in the smallest unit of asset)
example: 500
minimum: 0

CreateAssetRateInput.description: CreateAssetRateInput is the input payload to create an asset rate. Contains required fields for setting up asset conversion rates, including source and target assets, rate value, scale, and optional metadata.

externalId.description:
External identifier for integration (optional)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

from.description:
Source asset code (required)
example: USD
required: true
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

metadata.description:
Additional custom attributes (optional)
example: {"provider": "Central Bank", "rateName": "Official Exchange Rate"}

rate.description:
Conversion rate value (required)
example: 100
required: true

scale.description:
Decimal places for the rate (optional)
example: 2
minimum: 0

source.description:
Source of rate information (optional)
example: External System
maxLength: 200

to.description:
Target asset code (required)
example: BRL
required: true
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

CreateTransactionInflowSwaggerModel.description: Schema for creating inflow transaction with the complete SendInflow operation structure defined inline

chartOfAccountsGroupName.description:
Chart of accounts group name for accounting purposes
example: FUNDING
maxLength: 256

code.description:
Transaction code for reference
example: TR12345
maxLength: 100

description.description:
Human-readable description of the transaction
example: New Inflow Transaction
maxLength: 256

send.description:
Send operation details including distribution only
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code for the transaction
example: USD
required: true

distribute.description:
Destination accounts and amounts for the transaction
required: true

to.description:
List of destination operations
required: true

amount.description:
Amount details for the operation
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code
example: USD
required: true

value.description:
Amount value in smallest unit
example: 100
required: true

chartOfAccounts.description:
Chart of accounts code
example: FUNDING_CREDIT

scale.description:
Decimal places for the transaction amount
example: 2
required: true

value.description:
Transaction amount value in the smallest unit of the asset
example: 100
required: true

CreateTransactionOutflowSwaggerModel.description: Schema for creating outflow transaction with the complete SendOutflow operation structure defined inline

chartOfAccountsGroupName.description:
Chart of accounts group name for accounting purposes
example: WITHDRAWAL
maxLength: 256

code.description:
Transaction code for reference
example: TR12345
maxLength: 100

description.description:
Human-readable description of the transaction
example: New Outflow Transaction
maxLength: 256

pending.description:
Whether the transaction should be created in pending state
example: true
swagger: type boolean

send.description:
Send operation details including source only
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code for the transaction
example: USD
required: true

source.description:
Source accounts and amounts for the transaction
required: true

from.description:
List of source operations
required: true

amount.description:
Amount details for the operation
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code
example: USD
required: true

value.description:
Amount value in smallest unit
example: "100"
required: true

chartOfAccounts.description:
Chart of accounts code
example: WITHDRAWAL_DEBIT

value.description:
Transaction amount value in the smallest unit of the asset
example: "100"
required: true

Error.description: Standardized error response format used across all API endpoints for error situations. Provides structured information about errors including codes, messages, and field-specific validation details.

code.description:
Error code identifying the specific error condition
example: ERR_INVALID_INPUT
maxLength: 50

entityType.description:
Optional type of entity associated with the error
example: Organization
maxLength: 100

fields.description:
Optional detailed field validations for client-side handling
example: {"name": "Field 'name' is required"}

message.description:
Detailed error message explaining the issue
example: The request contains invalid fields. Please check the field 'name' and try again.
maxLength: 500
message.example: The request contains invalid fields. Please check the field 'name' and try again.

title.description:
Short, human-readable error title
example: Bad Request
maxLength: 100

Operation.description: Operation is a struct designed to store operation data. Represents a financial operation that affects account balances, including details such as amount, balance before and after, transaction association, and metadata.

accountAlias.description:
Human-readable alias for the account
example: @person1
maxLength: 256

accountId.description:
Account identifier associated with this operation
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

assetCode.description:
Asset code for the operation
example: BRL
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

balanceId.description:
Balance identifier affected by this operation
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

chartOfAccounts.description:
Chart of accounts code for accounting purposes
example: 1000
maxLength: 20

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the operation was created
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the operation was deleted (if soft-deleted)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

description.description:
Human-readable description of the operation
example: Credit card operation
maxLength: 256

id.description:
Unique identifier for the operation
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

transactionId.description:
Parent transaction identifier
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

type.description:
Type of operation (e.g., DEBIT, CREDIT)
example: DEBIT
maxLength: 50

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the operation was last updated
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

Pagination.description: Pagination is the struct designed to store the pagination data of an entity list.

Status.description: Status is the struct designed to represent the status of a transaction. Contains code and optional description for transaction states.

code.description:
Status code identifying the state of the transaction
example: ACTIVE
maxLength: 100

description.description:
Optional descriptive text explaining the status
example: Active status
maxLength: 256

Transaction.description: Transaction is a struct designed to store transaction data. Represents a financial transaction that consists of multiple operations affecting account balances, including details about the transaction's status, amounts, and related operations.

amount.description:
Transaction amount value in the smallest unit of the asset
example: 1500
minimum: 0

assetCode.description:
Asset code for the transaction
example: BRL
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

chartOfAccountsGroupName.description:
Chart of accounts group name for accounting purposes
example: Chart of accounts group name
maxLength: 256

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the transaction was created
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the transaction was deleted (if soft-deleted)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

description.description:
Human-readable description of the transaction
example: Transaction description
maxLength: 256

destination.description:
List of destination account aliases or identifiers
example: ["@person2"]

id.description:
Unique identifier for the transaction
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

operations.description: List of operations associated with this transaction

parentTransactionId.description:
Parent transaction identifier (for reversals or child transactions)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

source.description:
List of source account aliases or identifiers
example: ["@person1"]

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the transaction was last updated
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

UpdateBalance.description: Request payload for updating an existing balance's permissions. All fields are optional - only specified fields will be updated. Omitted fields will remain unchanged.

allowReceiving.description:
Whether the account should be allowed to receive funds to this balance
required: false
example: true

allowSending.description:
Whether the account should be allowed to send funds from this balance
required: false
example: true

UpdateOperationInput.description: UpdateOperationInput is the input payload to update an operation. Contains fields that can be modified after an operation is created.

description.description:
Human-readable description of the operation
example: Credit card operation
maxLength: 256

UpdateTransactionInput.description: UpdateTransactionInput is the input payload to update a transaction. Contains fields that can be modified after a transaction is created.

description.description:
Human-readable description of the transaction
example: Transaction description
maxLength: 256

github_com_LerianStudio_midaz_components.description: Schema for creating transaction with the complete Send operation structure defined inline

chartOfAccountsGroupName.description:
Chart of accounts group name for accounting purposes
example: FUNDING
maxLength: 256

code.description:
Transaction code for reference
example: TR12345
maxLength: 100

description.description:
Human-readable description of the transaction
example: New Transaction
maxLength: 256

pending.description:
Whether the transaction should be created in pending state
example: true
swagger: type boolean

send.description:
Send operation details including source and distribution
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code for the transaction
example: USD
required: true

distribute.description:
Destination accounts and amounts for the transaction
required: true

to.description:
List of destination operations
required: true

amount.description:
Amount details for the operation
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code
example: USD
required: true

value.description:
Amount value in smallest unit
example: 100
required: true

chartOfAccounts.description:
Chart of accounts code
example: FUNDING_CREDIT

source.description:
Source accounts and amounts for the transaction
required: true

from.description:
List of source operations
required: true

account.description:
Account identifier or alias
example: @external/USD
required: true

amount.description:
Amount details for the operation
required: true

asset.description:
Asset code
example: USD
required: true

value.description:
Amount value in smallest unit
example: 100
required: true

chartOfAccounts.description:
Chart of accounts code
example: FUNDING_DEBIT

value.description:
Transaction amount value in the smallest unit of the asset
example: 100
required: true

mmodel.Balance.description: Complete balance entity containing all fields including system-generated fields like ID, creation timestamps, and metadata. This is the response format for balance operations. Balances represent the amount of a specific asset held in an account, including available and on-hold amounts.

accountId.description:
Account that holds this balance
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

accountType.description:
Type of account holding this balance
example: creditCard
maxLength: 50

alias.description:
Alias for the account, used for easy identification or tagging
example: @person1
maxLength: 256

allowReceiving.description:
Whether the account can receive funds to this balance
example: true

allowSending.description:
Whether the account can send funds from this balance
example: true

assetCode.description:
Asset code identifying the currency or asset type of this balance
example: USD
minLength: 2
maxLength: 10

available.description:
Amount available for transactions (in the smallest unit of the asset, e.g. cents)
example: 1500
minimum: 0

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the balance was created (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the balance was softly deleted, null if not deleted (RFC3339 format)
example: null
format: date-time

id.description:
Unique identifier for the balance (UUID format)
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

ledgerId.description:
Ledger containing the account this balance belongs to
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

metadata.description:
Custom key-value pairs for extending the balance information
example: {"purpose": "Main savings", "category": "Personal"}

onHold.description:
Amount currently on hold and unavailable for transactions
example: 500
minimum: 0

organizationId.description:
Organization that owns this balance
example: 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
format: uuid

updatedAt.description:
Timestamp when the balance was last updated (RFC3339 format)
example: 2021-01-01T00:00:00Z
format: date-time

version.description:
Optimistic concurrency control version
example: 1
minimum: 1
